newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian 96 non-CIS oil exports 105 mln T- Interfax.
newsitem.headline: Russian 96 non-CIS oil exports 105 mln T- Interfax.

text.p: Russian crude oil exports outside the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) rose to 105.03 million tonnes in 1996 (2.10 million barrels per day), up 9.2 percent from 96.21 million tonnes (1.92 million bpd) in 1995, Interfax news agency said on Tuesday.

Interfax quoted the State Statistics Committee as saying that 1996 Russian oil exports to all destinations rose to 125.64 million tonnes (2.51 million bpd) compared with 122.34 million tonnes (2.45 million bpd) in 1995.
Russian non-CIS exports of oil products rose to 54.88 million tonnes in 1996 from 43.55 million tonnes in 1995, Interfax said.
Total Russian oil product exports last year were 56.48 million tonnes compared with 47.08 million tonnes in 1995.

Russian natural gas exports outside the CIS in 1996 rose to 128.00 billion cubic metres from 121.88 billion in 1995. Gas exports to all destinations also rose last year to 196.45 billion cubic metres from 192.19 billion in 1995.
Committee figures showed average earnings on oil exported outside the CIS in 1996 rose to $131.9 per tonne against $108.2 in 1995.
